sub_title: GZ-(neuro)psycholoog & praktijkopleider GZ bij neuroCare Group Nijmegen
summary:
Professionally trained neuropsychologist and health care psychologist (GZ) active as therapist in the applied field of neuromodulated psychotherapy at neuroCare Group Nijmegen. Prior to that active in the applied field of (cognitive) rehabilitation for people with acquired brain damage at an outpatient clinic at the Sint Maartenskliniek. Besides my work as therapist I participate in teaching several clinical neuropsychology courses at a post-graduate level (GZ) at the Radboud University of Nijmegen and at CCD Opleidingen. Current board membership in the Council of Members for the Dutch Institute for Psychology (NIP). Prior positions have included board membership of the Rehabilitation chapter of the Dutch Psychology Association (NIP), board membership of a national governing committee "Kamer GZ" and consultancy for a regional expert team with regard to acquired brain damage.  

Topics of interest: neuromodulation (rTMS, tDCS and neurofeedback amongst others) in combination with psychotherapy, (neuromodulated) treatment of "brain fog", treatment-resistant depression/OCD, AD(H)D and sleep, cognitive rehabilitation, neuropsychotherapy, neuropsychological assessment, post-stroke fatigue, hemi-inattention, mild TBI/stroke
Teaching (clinical) neuropsychology at various educational levels, supervision of students (GZ), especially (neuro)psychological assessment. 
Board work: the (governance of the) education of psychologists.

education.field_of_study: Latijn, Nederlands, Engels, Frans, Scheikunde, Wiskunde B, Natuurkunde

awards.title: Teacher of the Year (2012)
awards.description: In june of 2012 I had the honour of being elected "Teacher of the Year" by students and colleagues from RCSW (SPON) Postdoctoral Education ("GZ-opleiding V&O"). This was in recognition of the work I had done for the 20 week course "clinical neuropsychology" as teacher and coordinator. A presentation video was made that was used in the election process. This can still be seen here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kFCd-2HLV2c

profile_positions.description: After 17 years of working with brain-injured people at a rehabilitation clinic, I sought out an opportunity at neuroCare Group Nijmegen (NCG, formerly know as BrainClinics). NCG specializes in neuromodulation techniques; non-invasive stimulation of the brain via magnetic induction or the appliance of direct current (rTMS & tDCS) mainly in depression and OCD, and also in the use of neurofeedback towards ADHD and sleep disorders. The main aim is to either directely ameliorate aforementioned conditions or strengthen the effects of psychotherapy treatment which is often given simultaneously. We are positioned and recognized as an institute for mental health care. Aside from the neuromodulation treatments, there is a strong focus on neuroscientific research with the goal to improve the treatment techniques (precision medicine & response prediction via biomarkers) and explore new application possibilities. We strive to include every patient in ongoing research and there is a neurophysiology lab integrated within the practice that supplies a whole range of diagnostic procedures & instruments like qEEG and neuropsychological evaluation. The neuroCare Group is active in the Netherlands with treatment centers in Nijmegen, Arnhem, Den Haag, Hengelo, Groningen, Eindhoven and Amsterdam, and we have clinics  in Munich in Germany, Nashville & Long Island in the US, Bologna in Italy, and Sydney & Melbourne in Australia. While neuroCare is the treatment division, we also supply practice-oriented medical devices via neuroCare Solutions and provide (online) training courses and workshops via neuroCademy. Since 2018 I fulfill the position of senior lecturer for (online) neuroCademy for the rTMS and neurofeedback courses.  Aside from treating patients and teaching, I also manage the GZ-opleiding (health psychology) for neuroCare to help other therapists gain their title as health care psychologist.
profile_positions.title: GZ-(neuro)psycholoog & praktijkopleider GZ

profile_positions.description: The Stichting Hersenstimulatie, or the Dutch/Belgian Foundation for Brain Stimulation is a non-profit organisation that promotes the scientific study and clinical application of non-invasive brain stimulation (NIBS), also known as neuromodulation techniques. They are also tasked with monitoring the certification process to become a registered rTMS technician or professional. From 2022 on, people who want to apply rTMS in a clinical setting (and get reimbursement for treatment) are required to take a learning course, do hands-on training and also fullfil a certain number of hours of supervision. I -among others- will be providing that supervision on behalf of the foundation, and can be contacted via LinkedIn or via neuroCare Group Nijmegen for more information.
profile_positions.title: rTMS Supervisor

profile_positions.description:
SPON or RCSW opleidingen as they are called from 2015 on, is a certified learning institute that is linked to the Radboud University of Nijmegen. It offers several post-graduate training programs, one of which is the 2-year "GZ-opleiding" or Health Psychology (explained elsewhere). 
I teach within a 15 week course titled "Clinical Neuropsychology" which is one of the major courses in the second year. I work within a team of several other teachers with a clinical background. The aim of the course is for students to develop a basic understanding of neuropsychology as it is applied in a diverse array of clinical and outpatient settings. Students have to acquire knowledge about neuroanatomy, functional neuroanatomy, neuropsychological function domains, imaging techniques, and neuropsychological assessment and treatment. Additionally they learn about several neurological, neuropsychiatric and degenerative diseases that are accompanied by neuropsychological impairment. Besides developing and teaching the course over the last several years, between 2009 and 2018 I also coordinated the team of teachers and facilitated in several other areas like selecting and acquiring literature, compiling and administering the literature examination at the halfway point, and helping students with their neuropsychological case study and grading it (which is the final exam for the course). In 2011 I took part in the mandatory 5-year review of the total course program which was aimed toward gaining renewal of the license to offer the program. In 2012 I was chosen as "teacher of the year" by students and colleagues from SPON/RCSW, an honour I'm still very happy with! I also participated in the development and implementation of the “CGO” method that is now used nationally to form the educational backbone of the whole teaching program.
profile_positions.title: Teacher and coordinator

profile_positions.description: Cure & Care Development is a certified learning institute that offers post-graduate training programs, one of which is the 2-year "GZ-opleiding" or Healthcare psychology. I teach a 4-day course titled "Getting to know Clinical Neuropsychology", a primer for program participants who predominantly work within mental healthcare. I work within a small team of teachers with a clinical and/or scientific background. The aim of the course is for students to develop a basic understanding of neuropsychology as it is applied in a diverse array of clinical and outpatient settings. Students have to acquire knowledge about neuroanatomy, functional neuroanatomy, neuropsychological function domains, neuropsychiatric and neurodevelopmental syndromes, and neuropsychological assessment.
profile_positions.title: Teacher and coordinator

profile_positions.description:
The NVGzP is the Dutch Society for Health Psychology and her Specialisms. It was founded in 2012 and quickly grew a substantial membership base. The mission of the society is to specifically promote the interests of psychologists who are registered as general health psychologist (GZ-psycholoog) or as a specialist in that field (KNP-KP). The "Ledenraad" or Council of Members monitors the policies of the Executive Board of the society. It also actively provides policy advice to the Board, i.e. takes the role of "sounding board". The Council of Members consists of 24 members who are in their selection a reflection of the professional fields in which health psychologists are active. The Council convenes 2 times a year and can be consulted or convened in between when necessary. Within the Council I hold a special interest in all things related to (the governance of) the education of psychologists, their professional position within health care , and the structure of our "beroepsgebouw" or internal professional stratification of aptitude levels. The NVGzP is a very proactive society, driven by concrete results and reacting fast to developments that touch upon the mission of the society.
Since October of 2022, NVGzP merged with NIP (Dutch Institute for Psychology) to have one national body that represents the interests and societal position of psychology and psychologists. I participated with fellow Council members in the merger to actively monitor and oversee this process, and to safeguard specifically the interests of psychologists that work in healthcare. We as a group judged the merger to be in the greater interest of psychologists than staying apart, while stressing that precautions should be taken to not lose the pro-active culture of the NVGzP and strategic advantages we had while being seperate entities. I will fulfill the rest of my second term within the newly formed Council, consisting of the members of both the old NIP and NVGzP councils.
profile_positions.title: Lid van de NIP (oud-NVGzP) Ledenraad

profile_positions.description: In addition to clinical work and education, I have functioned as board member of the chapter "rehabilitation" of the Dutch Psychological Association (NIP). This chapter is concerned with the interests, position and public profile of psychologists and pedagogues that work in Dutch rehabilitation centers. Typical topics of discussion are health care financing, development of rehabilitation treatment guidelines, scientific research within the context of evidence based medicine, privacy issues concerning the use of electronic patient information systems, development and safeguarding of rehabilitation education at universities and post-graduate level, and promoting induction of members into quality assurance databases as related to Health Psychology and specialist degrees. My main focus was on aforementioned topic of education and degrees of competence. The chapter is organisationally located within the Health Care subdivision of the association and is linked closely to the chapters "Neuropsychology", "Medical Psychology", and "Geronto-psychology". When I pursued a different field of work in 2017 and started at the neuroCare Group Nijmegen, I decided to also give up this board position.
profile_positions.title: Board member

company.name: Ambulant Centrum Hersenletsel Nijmegen, Sint Maartenskliniek

profile_positions.description:
I worked 17 years as a professionally trained neuropsychologist and healthcare psychologist at an outpatient clinic for people with acquired brain damage in the chronic phase. I was involved in the neuropsychological evaluation, education, strategy training and psychological counseling of aforementioned patients and their families. I also participated in development and scientific research of new treatments within the whole of the programme. I teach several neuropsychology and rehabilitation psychology courses for students and health care professionals at academic and postgraduate level at the Radboud University of Nijmegen. From 2010 on I took on the responsibility of coordinating the GZ-opleiding for the Sint Maartenskliniek. In 2017 I decided to leave the Sint Maartenskliniek to pursue other career interests and I now work for the neuroCare Group Nijmegen.
While at the Sint Maartenskliniek, I was especially interested in the topics of poststroke fatigue, hemi-inattention, executive function and the sequelae of mild brain injury. The Ambulant Centrum Hersenletsel is part of the rehabilitation centre the Sint Maartenskliniek in Nijmegen.
In addition to clinical work and education, I also functioned as board member of the chapter "rehabilitation" of the Dutch Psychological Association (NIP), occupied a seat the "Kamer GZ" and participated in several regional expert meetings concerning acquired brain injury.
profile_positions.title: GZ-(neuro)psycholoog / Praktijkopleider GZ

profile_positions.description: On behalf of the NIP sectie Revalidatie I accepted a seat in the "Kamer GZ". This position can be held for 3 years at a time and members can be re-elected once. The "Kamer GZ" is a national board in which 6 representatives of the NIP Health Care chapter take seat, as well as 2 representatives of the NVO and the directors of the 6 regional postacademic learning institutes that provide the 2 year Health Psychology (GZ) course. The "Kamer GZ" has a supervisory function towards the 6 course programs concerning legal requirements and qualitive aspects and reviews them periodically after which a renewed license can be given. It has an advisory function towards development of content within the course programs and development of additional specialisations within the field of Health Psychology. The board is recognised by the CONO and reports to it. In 2013 I took up the role of treasurer. In 2015 the "Kamer GZ"l ceased it's activities to facilitate a restructuring of the so-called "governance"
profile_positions.title: Lid Kamer GZ
